cyclone.name: CINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana

motion.speed: 0 mph (will increase to ~10 mph toward NW)

cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest toward the southwest Louisiana–upper Texas coast, then turn north and move inland through Louisiana and eastern Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cameron, LA–Port Arthur, TX coast (just west of Lake Charles)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect (all converted to warnings)
weather_observation.warning_coast: San Luis Pass, TX eastward to the Mouth of the Pearl River, LA (includes Lake Charles area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South‐central Texas coast eastward across southern and southwestern Louisiana and into the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (25–45 mph sustained, higher gusts) possible beginning late Wednesday and continuing into Thursday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 1–3 ft above ground level possible along lakes, bays and low-lying coastal portions of the Calcasieu estuary
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated 6 inches; threat of flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible as outer rain bands move onshore
